org.qcri.rheem.core.plan.rheemplan

Class RheemPlan

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.qcri.rheem.core.plan.rheemplan.RheemPlan

  • public class RheemPlan
extends java.lang.Object
    A Rheem plan consists of a set of Operators.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RheemPlan(Operator... sinks)
      Creates a new instance and does some preprocessing (such as loop isolation).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addSink(Operator sink)
      Deprecated. 
      Use RheemPlan(Operator...).

      Apply all available transformations in the configuration to this instance.
      java.util.Collection<Operator> collectReachableTopLevelSources()
      Find the source Operators that are reachable from the sinks.

      Find the Operator in this instance by their name.

      Find the Operators in this instance by their name.
      java.util.Collection<Operator> getSinks() 
      boolean isLoopsIsolated()
      Tells whether potential loops within this instance have been isolated.
      boolean isSane()
      Check that the given RheemPlan is as we expect it to be in the following steps.
      void prepare()
      Prepares this RheemPlan for the optimization process if not already done.
      void prune()
      Prunes Operators that do not (indirectly) contribute to a sink.

      Replaces an oldSink with a newSink.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RheemPlan

        public RheemPlan(Operator... sinks)
        Creates a new instance and does some preprocessing (such as loop isolation).
        Parameters:
        sinks - the sinks of the new instance

    • Method Detail

      • prepare

        public void prepare()
        Prepares this RheemPlan for the optimization process if not already done.

      • addSink

        @Deprecated
public void addSink(Operator sink)
        Deprecated. Use RheemPlan(Operator...).

      • replaceSink

        public void replaceSink(Operator oldSink,
                        Operator newSink)
        Replaces an oldSink with a newSink. As with all modifications to this instance, it is up to the caller to ensure that this does not destroy the integrity of this instance.

      • getSinks

        public java.util.Collection<Operator> getSinks()

      • collectReachableTopLevelSources

        public java.util.Collection<Operator> collectReachableTopLevelSources()
        Find the source Operators that are reachable from the sinks.
        Returns:
        the reachable sources, only top-level operators are considered
        See Also:
        getSinks()

      • collectTopLevelOperatorsByName

        public java.util.Collection<Operator> collectTopLevelOperatorsByName(java.lang.String name)
        Find the Operators in this instance by their name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Operators
        Returns:
        the matching Operators; only top-level (non-nested) ones are considered

      • collectTopLevelOperatorByName

        public Operator collectTopLevelOperatorByName(java.lang.String name)
                                       throws RheemException
        Find the Operator in this instance by their name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Operators
        Returns:
        the matching Operator or null if none
        Throws:
        RheemException - if there is more than one such Operator

      • prune

        public void prune()
        Prunes Operators that do not (indirectly) contribute to a sink.

      • applyTransformations

        public void applyTransformations(java.util.Collection<PlanTransformation> transformations)
        Apply all available transformations in the configuration to this instance.

      • isSane

        public boolean isSane()
        Check that the given RheemPlan is as we expect it to be in the following steps.

      • isLoopsIsolated

        public boolean isLoopsIsolated()
        Tells whether potential loops within this instance have been isolated.

      • setLoopsIsolated

        public void setLoopsIsolated()
        Tells that potential loops within this instance have been isolated.
